e.name: inputMediaInvoice
e.comment: Generated invoice of a bot payment

arguments.name: photo
arguments.comment: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.name: payload
arguments.comment: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.comment: JSON-encoded data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: start_param
arguments.comment: Unique bot deep links start parameter. If present, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter. If absent, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice.

arguments.name: self
arguments.comment: Whether this user indicates the currently logged in user

arguments.name: contact
arguments.comment:
Whether this user is a contact
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.

arguments.name: mutual_contact
arguments.comment:
Whether this user is a mutual contact.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.

arguments.name: deleted
arguments.comment:
Whether the account of this user was deleted.
Changes to this flag should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.comment:
Is this user a bot?
Changes to this flag should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: bot_chat_history
arguments.comment: Can the bot see all messages in groups?

arguments.name: bot_nochats
arguments.comment: Can the bot be added to groups?

arguments.name: restricted
arguments.comment: Access to this user must be restricted for the reason specified in restriction_reason

arguments.name: bot_inline_geo
arguments.comment: Whether the bot can request our geolocation in inline mode

arguments.name: support
arguments.comment: Whether this is an official support user

arguments.name: scam
arguments.comment: This may be a scam user

arguments.name: apply_min_photo
arguments.comment: If set and min is set, the value of photo can be used to update the local database, see the documentation of that flag for more info.

arguments.name: fake
arguments.comment: If set, this user was reported by many users as a fake or scam user: be careful when interacting with them.

arguments.name: bot_attach_menu
arguments.comment: Whether this bot offers an attachment menu web app

arguments.name: premium
arguments.comment:
Whether this user is a Telegram Premium user
Changes to this flag should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID, see here Â» for more info.
Changes to this flag if the self flag is set should also trigger the following calls, to refresh the respective caches:
- The {@link help.RawGetConfigRequest} cache
- The {@link messages.RawGetTopReactionsRequest} cache if the bot flag is not set

arguments.name: attach_menu_enabled
arguments.comment:
Whether we installed the attachment menu web app offered by this bot.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.

arguments.name: bot_can_edit
arguments.comment:
Whether we can edit the profile picture, name, about text and description of this bot because we own it.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.
Changes to this flag (if min is not set) should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID.

arguments.name: close_friend
arguments.comment:
Whether we marked this user as a close friend, see here Â» for more info.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.

arguments.name: stories_hidden
arguments.comment:
Whether we have hidden Â» all active stories of this user.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag is set.

arguments.name: stories_unavailable
arguments.comment: No stories from this user are visible.

arguments.name: contact_require_premium
arguments.comment: See here for more info on this flag Â».

arguments.name: bot_business
arguments.comment: Whether this bot can be connected to a user as specified here Â».

arguments.name: bot_has_main_app
arguments.comment: If set, this bot has configured a Main Mini App Â».

arguments.name: id
arguments.comment: ID of the user, see here Â» for more info and the available ID range.

arguments.name: access_hash
arguments.comment:
Access hash of the user, see here Â» for more info.
If this flag is set, when updating the local peer database, generate a virtual flag called min_access_hash, which is:
- Set to true if min is set AND
-- The phone flag is not set OR
-- The phone flag is set and the associated phone number string is non-empty
- Set to false otherwise.

Then, apply both access_hash and min_access_hash to the local database if:
- min_access_hash is false OR
- min_access_hash is true AND
-- There is no locally cached object for this user OR
-- There is no access_hash in the local cache OR
-- The cached object's min_access_hash is also true

If the final merged object stored to the database has the min_access_hash field set to true, the related access_hash is only suitable to use in {@link RawInputPeerPhotoFileLocation}, to directly download the profile pictures of users, everywhere else a inputPeer*FromMessage constructor will have to be generated as specified here Â».
Bots can also use min access hashes in some conditions, by passing 0 instead of the min access hash.

arguments.name: first_name
arguments.comment:
First name.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.

arguments.name: last_name
arguments.comment:
Last name.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.

arguments.name: username
arguments.comment:
Main active username.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.
Changes to this flag should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID if the above conditions are respected and the bot_can_edit flag is also set.

arguments.name: phone
arguments.comment:
Phone number.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.

arguments.name: photo
arguments.comment:
Profile picture of user.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The apply_min_photo flag is set OR
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.

arguments.name: status
arguments.comment:
Online status of user.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set OR
-- The locally cached user entry is equal to {@link RawUserStatusEmpty}.

arguments.name: bot_info_version
arguments.comment:
Version of the {@link RawUserFull}, incremented every time it changes.
Changes to this flag should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: restriction_reason
arguments.comment: Contains the reason why access to this user must be restricted.

arguments.name: bot_inline_placeholder
arguments.comment: Inline placeholder for this inline bot

arguments.name: usernames
arguments.comment:
Additional usernames.
When updating the local peer database, apply changes to this field only if:
- The min flag is not set OR
- The min flag is set AND
-- The min flag of the locally cached user entry is set.
Changes to this flag (if the above conditions are respected) should invalidate the local {@link RawUserFull} cache for this user ID.

arguments.name: stories_max_id
arguments.comment:
ID of the maximum read story.
When updating the local peer database, do not apply changes to this field if the min flag of the incoming constructor is set.

arguments.name: bot_active_users
arguments.comment: Monthly Active Users (MAU) of this bot (may be absent for small bots).

arguments.name: send_paid_messages_stars
arguments.comment: If set, the user has enabled paid messages Â», we might need to pay the specified amount of Stars to send them messages, depending on the configured exceptions: check {@link RawUserFull}.send_paid_messages_stars or {@link users.RawGetRequirementsToContactRequest} to see if the currently logged in user actually has to pay or not, see here Â» for the full flow.

e.comment: Indicates info about a certain user. Unless specified otherwise, when updating the local peer database, all fields from the newly received constructor take priority over the old constructor cached locally (including by removing fields that aren't set in the new constructor). See here Â» for an implementation of the logic to use when updating the local user peer database.

arguments.comment:
Users may also choose to display messages from all topics of a forum as if they were sent to a normal group, using a "View as messages" setting in the local client.
This setting only affects the current account, and is synced to other logged in sessions using the {@link channels.RawToggleViewForumAsMessagesRequest} method; invoking this method will update the value of this flag.

If set and bigger than 0, this supergroup, monoforum or the monoforum associated to this channel has enabled paid messages Â» and we must pay the specified amount of Stars to send messages to it, see here Â» for the full flow.
This flag will be set both for the monoforum and for {@link RawChannelFull} of the associated channel).
If set and equal to 0, the monoforum requires payment in general but we were exempted from paying.

arguments.name: mentioned
arguments.comment: Whether we were mentioned in this message

arguments.comment: Whether there are unread media attachments in this message

arguments.comment: Whether this is a silent message (no notification triggered)

arguments.comment: Whether this is a channel post

arguments.name: legacy
arguments.comment: This is a legacy message: it has to be refetched with the new layer

arguments.name: edit_hide
arguments.comment: Whether the message should be shown as not modified to the user, even if an edit date is present

arguments.name: noforwards
arguments.comment: Whether this message is protected and thus cannot be forwarded; clients should also prevent users from saving attached media (i.e. videos should only be streamed, photos should be kept in RAM, et cetera).

arguments.name: invert_media
arguments.comment: If set, any eventual webpage preview will be shown on top of the message instead of at the bottom.

arguments.name: offline
arguments.comment: If set, the message was sent because of a scheduled action by the message sender, for example, as away, or a greeting service message.

arguments.name: video_processing_pending
arguments.comment:
The video contained in the message is currently being processed by the server (i.e. to generate alternative qualities, that will be contained in the final {@link RawMessageMediaDocument}.alt_document), and will be sent once the video is processed, which will happen approximately at the specified date (i.e. messages with this flag set should be treated similarly to scheduled messages, but instead of the scheduled date, date contains the estimated conversion date).
See here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: paid_suggested_post_stars
arguments.comment: Set if this is a suggested channel post Â» that was paid using Telegram Stars.

arguments.name: paid_suggested_post_ton
arguments.comment: Set if this is a suggested channel post Â» that was paid using Toncoins.

arguments.name: from_id
arguments.comment: ID of the sender of the message

arguments.name: from_boosts_applied
arguments.comment:
Supergroups only, contains the number of boosts this user has given the current supergroup, and should be shown in the UI in the header of the message.
Only present for incoming messages from non-anonymous supergroup members that have boosted the supergroup.
Note that this counter should be locally overridden for non-anonymous outgoing messages, according to the current value of {@link RawChannelFull}.boosts_applied, to ensure the value is correct even for messages sent by the current user before a supergroup was boosted (or after a boost has expired or the number of boosts has changed); do not update this value for incoming messages from other users, even if their boosts have changed.

arguments.name: peer_id
arguments.comment: Peer ID, the chat where this message was sent

arguments.name: saved_peer_id
arguments.comment:
Messages from a saved messages dialog Â» will have peer={@link RawInputPeerSelf} and the saved_peer_id flag set to the ID of the saved dialog.
Messages from a monoforum Â» will have peer=ID of the monoforum and the saved_peer_id flag set to the ID of a topic.

arguments.comment: ID of the inline bot that generated the message

arguments.name: via_business_bot_id

arguments.name: restriction_reason

arguments.name: ttl_period
arguments.comment: Time To Live of the message, once message.date+message.ttl_period === time(), the message will be deleted on the server, and must be deleted locally as well.

arguments.name: quick_reply_shortcut_id
arguments.comment: If set, this message is a quick reply shortcut message Â» (note that quick reply shortcut messages sent to a private chat will not have this field set).

arguments.name: effect

arguments.name: report_delivery_until_date
arguments.comment: Used for Telegram Gateway verification messages: if set and the current unixtime is bigger than the specified unixtime, invoke {@link messages.RawReportMessagesDeliveryRequest} passing the ID and the peer of this message as soon as it is received by the client (optionally batching requests for the same peer).

arguments.name: paid_message_stars
arguments.comment: The amount of stars the sender has paid to send the message, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: suggested_post

The optional fields specify how did we authorize the bot to send us messages.

arguments.comment: Whether this gift was converted to Telegram Stars and cannot be displayed on the profile anymore.

arguments.comment: This gift was upgraded to a collectible gift Â».

arguments.comment: This gift is not available anymore because a request to refund the payment related to this gift was made, and the money was returned.

arguments.comment: If set, this gift can be upgraded to a collectible gift; can only be set for the receiver of a gift.

The receiver of this gift may convert it to this many Telegram Stars, instead of displaying it on their profile page.
convert_stars will be equal to stars only if the gift was bought using recently bought Telegram Stars, otherwise it will be less than stars.

To set this flag for ourselves invoke {@link account.RawSetGlobalPrivacySettingsRequest}, setting the settings.new_noncontact_peers_require_premium flag, see here Â» for more info.

If set, we cannot fetch the exact read date of messages we send to this user using {@link messages.RawGetOutboxReadDateRequest}.
The exact read date of messages might still be unavailable for other reasons, see {@link messages.RawGetOutboxReadDateRequest} for more info.
To set this flag for ourselves invoke {@link account.RawSetGlobalPrivacySettingsRequest}, setting the settings.hide_read_marks flag.

If set and bigger than 0, this user has enabled paid messages Â» and we must pay the specified amount of Stars to send messages to them, see here Â» for the full flow.

In case the popup parameter was passed, the text message must be displayed in a popup alert immediately upon receipt. This update can only be received through getDifference or in {@link RawUpdates}/{@link RawUpdatesCombined} constructors, so it will always come bundled with the updated {@link RawChat}, that should be applied as usual Â», without re-fetching the info manually. However, full peer information will not come bundled in updates, so the full peer cache ({@link RawChatFull}) must be invalidated for chat_id when receiving this update.

Once a story is successfully uploaded, an {@link RawUpdateStoryID} will be returned, indicating the story ID (id) that was attributed to the story (like for messages, random_id indicates the random_id that was passed to {@link stories.RawSendStoryRequest}: this way, you can tell which story was assigned a specific id by checking which {@link stories.RawSendStoryRequest} call has the returned random_id).

e.name: updateChannelViewForumAsMessages
e.comment:
Users may also choose to display messages from all topics as if they were sent to a normal group, using a "View as messages" setting in the local client.
This setting only affects the current account, and is synced to other logged in sessions using the {@link channels.RawToggleViewForumAsMessagesRequest} method; invoking this method will update the value of the view_forum_as_messages flag of {@link RawChannelFull} or {@link RawDialog} and emit an {@link RawUpdateChannelViewForumAsMessages}.

arguments.name: enabled
arguments.comment: The new value of the toggle.

arguments.comment: If set, this IP should be used when connecting through a proxy

arguments.comment: If set, clients must connect using only the specified port, without trying any other port.

e.comment: Current configuration

arguments.name: default_p2p_contacts
arguments.comment: Whether the client should use P2P by default for phone calls with contacts

arguments.name: preload_featured_stickers
arguments.comment: Whether the client should preload featured stickers

arguments.name: revoke_pm_inbox
arguments.comment: Whether incoming private messages can be deleted for both participants

arguments.name: blocked_mode
arguments.comment: Indicates that telegram is probably censored by governments/ISPs in the current region

arguments.name: force_try_ipv6
arguments.comment: Whether to forcefully connect using IPv6 dcOptions, even if the client knows that IPv4 is available.

arguments.name: expires
arguments.comment: Expiration date of this config: when it expires it'll have to be refetched using {@link help.RawGetConfigRequest}

arguments.name: test_mode
arguments.comment: Whether we're connected to the test DCs

arguments.name: this_dc
arguments.comment: ID of the DC that returned the reply

arguments.name: dc_txt_domain_name
arguments.comment: Domain name for fetching encrypted DC list from DNS TXT record

arguments.name: forwarded_count_max
arguments.comment: Maximum number of messages that can be forwarded at once using {@link messages.RawForwardMessagesRequest}.

arguments.name: online_update_period_ms
arguments.comment: The client should {@link account.RawUpdateStatusRequest} every N milliseconds

arguments.name: offline_blur_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: Delay before offline status needs to be sent to the server

arguments.name: offline_idle_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: Time without any user activity after which it should be treated offline

arguments.name: online_cloud_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: If we are offline, but were online from some other client in last online_cloud_timeout_ms milliseconds after we had gone offline, then delay offline notification for notify_cloud_delay_ms milliseconds.

arguments.name: notify_cloud_delay_ms
arguments.comment: If we are offline, but online from some other client then delay sending the offline notification for notify_cloud_delay_ms milliseconds.

arguments.name: notify_default_delay_ms
arguments.comment: If some other client is online, then delay notification for notification_default_delay_ms milliseconds

arguments.name: edit_time_limit
arguments.comment: Only messages with age smaller than the one specified can be edited

arguments.name: revoke_time_limit
arguments.comment: Only channel/supergroup messages with age smaller than the specified can be deleted

arguments.name: revoke_pm_time_limit
arguments.comment: Only private messages with age smaller than the specified can be deleted

arguments.name: rating_e_decay
arguments.comment: Exponential decay rate for computing top peer rating

arguments.name: channels_read_media_period
arguments.comment: Indicates that round videos (video notes) and voice messages sent in channels and older than the specified period must be marked as read

arguments.name: call_receive_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: Maximum allowed outgoing ring time in VoIP calls: if the user we're calling doesn't reply within the specified time (in milliseconds), we should hang up the call

arguments.name: call_ring_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: Maximum allowed incoming ring time in VoIP calls: if the current user doesn't reply within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call will be automatically refused

arguments.name: call_connect_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: VoIP connection timeout: if the instance of libtgvoip on the other side of the call doesn't connect to our instance of libtgvoip within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call must be aborted

arguments.name: call_packet_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: If during a VoIP call a packet isn't received for the specified period of time, the call must be aborted

arguments.name: me_url_prefix
arguments.comment: The domain to use to parse deep links Â».

arguments.comment: URL to use to auto-update the current app

e.name: inputPrivacyKeyStatusTimestamp
e.comment: Whether people will be able to see our exact last online timestamp. Note that if we decide to hide our exact last online timestamp to someone (i.e., users A, B, C, or all users) and we do not have a Premium subscription, we won't be able to see the exact last online timestamp of those users (A, B, C, or all users), even if those users do share it with us. If those users do share their exact online status with us, but we can't see it due to the reason mentioned above, the by_me flag of {@link RawUserStatusRecently}, {@link RawUserStatusLastWeek}, {@link RawUserStatusLastMonth} will be set.

If those users do share their exact online status with us, but we can't see it due to the reason mentioned above, the by_me flag of {@link RawUserStatusRecently}, {@link RawUserStatusLastWeek}, {@link RawUserStatusLastMonth} will be set.

e.name: keyboardButtonUrlAuth
e.comment: Button to request a user to authorize via URL using Seamless Telegram Login. When the user clicks on such a button, {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest} should be called, providing the button_id and the ID of the container message. The returned {@link RawUrlAuthResultRequest} object will contain more details about the authorization request (request_write_access if the bot would like to send messages to the user along with the username of the bot which will be used for user authorization). Finally, the user can choose to call {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} to get a {@link RawUrlAuthResultAccepted} with the URL to open instead of the url of this constructor, or a {@link RawUrlAuthResultDefault}, in which case the url of this constructor must be opened, instead. If the user refuses the authorization request but still wants to open the link, the url of this constructor must be used.

arguments.name: fwd_text
arguments.comment: New text of the button in forwarded messages.

arguments.name: url
arguments.comment:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: Services must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

arguments.name: button_id
arguments.comment: ID of the button to pass to {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest}

e.name: inputKeyboardButtonUrlAuth
e.comment: Button to request a user to {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} via URL using Seamless Telegram Login.

arguments.name: request_write_access
arguments.comment: Set this flag to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

arguments.name: fwd_text
arguments.comment: New text of the button in forwarded messages.

arguments.name: url
arguments.comment:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.
NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.comment: Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

Filtering criteria to use for the peer selection list shown to the user.
The list should display all existing peers of the specified type, and should also offer an option for the user to create and immediately use one or more (up to max_quantity) peers of the specified type, if needed.

e.name: replyKeyboardHide
e.comment: Hide sent bot keyboard

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this flag if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet

e.name: replyKeyboardForceReply
e.comment: Force the user to send a reply

arguments.name: single_use
arguments.comment: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.
Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

arguments.name: placeholder
arguments.comment: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters.

e.name: replyKeyboardMarkup
e.comment: Bot keyboard

arguments.name: resize
arguments.comment: Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). If not set, the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

arguments.name: single_use
arguments.comment: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

arguments.name: persistent
arguments.comment: Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden.

arguments.name: placeholder
arguments.comment: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters.

arguments.name: saved_date
arguments.comment: Only for forwarded messages reforwarded to saved messages Â», indicates when was the original message sent (i.e. if user A sends a message @ unixtime 1, then user B forwards it somewhere @ unixtime 2, then user C saves it to saved messages @ unixtime 3, this field will contain 2, date will contain 1 and the date of the containing {@link RawMessage} will contain 3).

arguments.comment: Whether to archive and mute new chats from non-contacts

arguments.name: keep_archived_unmuted
arguments.comment: Whether unmuted chats will be kept in the Archive chat list when they get a new message.

arguments.name: keep_archived_folders
arguments.comment: Whether unmuted chats that are always included or pinned in a folder, will be kept in the Archive chat list when they get a new message. Ignored if keep_archived_unmuted is set.

arguments.name: hide_read_marks
arguments.comment:
If this flag is set, the {@link RawInputPrivacyKeyStatusTimestamp} key will also apply to the ability to use {@link messages.RawGetOutboxReadDateRequest} on messages sent to us.
Meaning, users that cannot see our exact last online date due to the current value of the {@link RawInputPrivacyKeyStatusTimestamp} key will receive a 403 USER_PRIVACY_RESTRICTED error when invoking {@link messages.RawGetOutboxReadDateRequest} to fetch the exact read date of a message they sent to us.
The {@link RawUserFull}.read_dates_private flag will be set for users that have this flag enabled.

arguments.name: new_noncontact_peers_require_premium
arguments.comment: See here for more info on this flag Â».

arguments.name: display_gifts_button
arguments.comment: Enables or disables our {@link RawUserFull}.display_gifts_button flag: if the {@link RawUserFull}.display_gifts_button flag of both us and another user is set, a gift button should always be displayed in the text field in private chats with the other user: once clicked, the gift UI should be displayed, offering the user options to gift Telegram Premium Â» subscriptions or Telegram Gifts Â».

arguments.name: noncontact_peers_paid_stars
arguments.comment: If configured, specifies the number of stars users must pay us to send us a message, see here Â» for more info on paid messages.

arguments.name: disallowed_gifts
arguments.comment: Disallows the reception of specific gift types.

arguments.name: offset_id_offset
arguments.comment:
Indicates the absolute position of messages[0] within the total result set with count count.
This is useful, for example, if we need to display a progress/total counter (like photo 134 of 200, for all media in a chat, we could simply use photo ${offset_id_offset} of ${count}.

arguments.name: periods
arguments.comment:
Used to split the messages by days: multiple SearchResultsCalendarPeriod constructors are returned, each containing information about the first, last and total number of messages matching the filter that were sent on a specific day.
This information can be easily used to split the returned messages by day.

arguments.comment: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

arguments.comment: Should be populated with the peer where the topup process was initiated due to low funds (i.e. a bot for bot payments, a channel for paid media/reactions, etc); leave this flag unpopulated if the topup flow was not initated when attempting to spend more Stars than currently available on the account's balance.

e.name: account.getBotBusinessConnection
e.comment:
Bots may invoke this method to re-fetch the {@link RawUpdateBotBusinessConnect} constructor associated with a specific business connection_id, see here Â» for more info on connected business bots.
This is needed for example for freshly logged in bots that are receiving some {@link RawUpdateBotNewBusinessMessage}, etc. updates because some users have already connected to the bot before it could login.
In this case, the bot is receiving messages from the business connection, but it hasn't cached the associated {@link RawUpdateBotBusinessConnect} with info about the connection (can it reply to messages? etc.) yet, and cannot receive the old ones because they were sent when the bot wasn't logged into the session yet.
This method can be used to fetch info about a not-yet-cached business connection, and should not be invoked if the info is already cached or to fetch changes, as eventual changes will automatically be sent as new {@link RawUpdateBotBusinessConnect} updates to the bot using the usual update delivery methods Â».

throws.name: CONNECTION_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified connection ID is invalid.

arguments.name: require_payment
arguments.comment:
If set, requires the user to pay in order to send us messages.
Can only be set by monoforums, not users, i.e. parent_peer must be set if this flag is set; users must instead use the {@link RawInputPrivacyKeyNoPaidMessages} privacy setting to remove a previously added exemption.
If not set, allows the user to send us messages without paying (can be unset by both monoforums and users).

e.name: messages.forwardMessages

arguments.name: silent
arguments.comment: Whether to send messages silently (no notification will be triggered on the destination clients)

arguments.name: background
arguments.comment: Whether to send the message in background

arguments.name: with_my_score
arguments.comment: When forwarding games, whether to include your score in the game

arguments.name: drop_author
arguments.comment: Whether to forward messages without quoting the original author

arguments.name: drop_media_captions
arguments.comment: Whether to strip captions from media

arguments.name: noforwards
arguments.comment: Only for bots, disallows further re-forwarding and saving of the messages, even if the destination chat doesn't have content protection enabled

arguments.name: allow_paid_floodskip
arguments.comment: Bots only: if set, allows sending up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance.

arguments.name: random_id
arguments.comment: Random ID to prevent resending of messages

arguments.name: reply_to
arguments.comment: Can only contain an {@link RawInputReplyToMonoForum}, to forward messages to a monoforum topic (mutually exclusive with top_msg_id).

arguments.name: schedule_date
arguments.comment: Scheduled message date for scheduled messages

arguments.name: send_as
arguments.comment: Forward the messages as the specified peer

arguments.name: quick_reply_shortcut
arguments.comment: Add the messages to the specified quick reply shortcut Â», instead.

arguments.name: video_timestamp
arguments.comment: Start playing the video at the specified timestamp (seconds).

arguments.name: allow_paid_stars
arguments.comment: For paid messages Â», specifies the amount of Telegram Stars the user has agreed to pay in order to send the message.

arguments.name: suggested_post
arguments.comment: Used to suggest a post to a channel, see here Â» for more info on the full flow.

e.name: messages.setInlineBotResults
e.comment: Answer an inline query, for bots only

arguments.name: gallery
arguments.comment: Set this flag if the results are composed of media files

arguments.name: private
arguments.comment: Set this flag if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

arguments.name: query_id
arguments.comment: Unique identifier for the answered query

arguments.name: results
arguments.comment: Vector of results for the inline query

arguments.name: cache_time
arguments.comment: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

arguments.name: next_offset
arguments.comment: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

arguments.name: switch_pm
arguments.comment: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with a certain parameter.

arguments.name: switch_webview
arguments.comment: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to the specified inline mode mini app.

arguments.comment: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: error
arguments.comment: Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

arguments.name: shipping_options
arguments.comment: A vector of available shipping options.

throws.name: QUERY_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The query ID is invalid.

throws.name: USER_BOT_REQUIRED
throws.comment: This method can only be called by a bot.

e.name: messages.setBotPrecheckoutResults
e.comment:
Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the bot receives an {@link RawUpdateBotPrecheckoutQuery} update.
Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries.
Note: Telegram must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

arguments.name: success
arguments.comment: Set this flag if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order, otherwise do not set it, and set the error field, instead

arguments.name: query_id
arguments.comment: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: error
arguments.comment: Required if the success isn't set. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

throws.name: ERROR_TEXT_EMPTY
throws.comment: The provided error message is empty.

throws.name: USER_BOT_REQUIRED
throws.comment: This method can only be called by a bot.

e.name: messages.getOutboxReadDate
e.comment:
Get the exact read date of one of our messages, sent to a private chat with another user. Can be only done for private outgoing messages not older than appConfig.pm_read_date_expire_period Â». If the peer's {@link RawUserFull}.read_dates_private flag is set, we will not be able to fetch the exact read date of messages we send to them, and a USER_PRIVACY_RESTRICTED RPC error will be emitted.
The exact read date of messages might still be unavailable for other reasons, see {@link RawGlobalPrivacySettings} for more info.
To set {@link RawUserFull}.read_dates_private for ourselves invoke {@link account.RawSetGlobalPrivacySettingsRequest}, setting the settings.hide_read_marks flag.

arguments.name: peer
arguments.comment: The user to whom we sent the message.

throws.name: MESSAGE_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided message id is invalid.

throws.name: MESSAGE_NOT_READ_YET
throws.comment: The specified message wasn't read yet.

throws.name: MESSAGE_TOO_OLD
throws.comment: The message is too old, the requested information is not available.

throws.name: PEER_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided peer id is invalid.

throws.name: USER_PRIVACY_RESTRICTED
throws.comment: The user's privacy settings do not allow you to do this.

throws.name: YOUR_PRIVACY_RESTRICTED
throws.comment: You cannot fetch the read date of this message because you have disallowed other users to do so for your messages; to fix, allow other users to see your exact last online date OR purchase a Telegram Premium subscription.

e.name: messages.sendPaidReaction
e.comment: Sends one or more paid Telegram Star reactions Â», transferring Telegram Stars Â» to a channel's balance.

arguments.name: count
arguments.comment: The number of stars to send (each will increment the reaction counter by one).

arguments.name: random_id
arguments.comment:
Unique client message ID required to prevent message resending.
Note: this argument must be composed of a 64-bit integer where the lower 32 bits are random, and the higher 32 bits are equal to the current unixtime, i.e. uint64_t random_id = (time() << 32) | ((uint64_t)random_uint32_t()): this differs from the random_id format of all other methods in the API, which just take 64 random bits.

arguments.name: private
arguments.comment: Each post with star reactions has a leaderboard with the top senders, but users can opt out of appearing there if they prefer more privacy. Not populating this field will use the default reaction privacy, stored on the server and synced to clients using {@link RawUpdatePaidReactionPrivacy} (see here for more info).

throws.name: BALANCE_TOO_LOW
throws.comment: The transaction cannot be completed because the current Telegram Stars balance is too low.

throws.name: CHANNEL_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided channel is invalid.

throws.name: CHAT_WRITE_FORBIDDEN
throws.comment: You can't write in this chat.

throws.name: MESSAGE_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided message id is invalid.

throws.name: PEER_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided peer id is invalid.

throws.name: RANDOM_ID_EMPTY
throws.comment: Random ID empty.

throws.name: RANDOM_ID_EXPIRED
throws.comment: The specified random_id was expired (most likely it didn't follow the required uint64_t random_id = (time() << 32) | ((uint64_t)random_uint32_t()) format, or the specified time is too far in the past).

throws.name: REACTIONS_COUNT_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified number of reactions is invalid.

throws.name: SEND_AS_PEER_INVALID

e.name: help.getRecentMeUrls
e.comment:
Get recently used t.me links. When installing official applications from "Download Telegram" buttons present in t.me pages, a referral parameter is passed to applications after installation.
If, after downloading the application, the user creates a new account (instead of logging into an existing one), the referral parameter should be imported using this method, which returns the t.me pages the user recently opened, before installing Telegram.

arguments.comment:
If set and the user has reached the limit of owned public channels/supergroups/geogroups, instead of returning the channel list one of the specified errors will be returned.
Useful to check if a new public channel can indeed be created, even before asking the user to enter a channel username to use in {@link channels.RawCheckUsernameRequest}/{@link channels.RawUpdateUsernameRequest}.

e.name: bots.updateStarRefProgram
e.comment: Create, edit or delete the affiliate program of a bot we own

arguments.name: commission_permille
arguments.comment:
The permille commission rate: it indicates the share of Telegram Stars received by affiliates for every transaction made by users they referred inside of the bot.
The minimum and maximum values for this parameter are contained in the starref_min_commission_permille and starref_max_commission_permille client configuration parameters.
Can be 0 to terminate the affiliate program.
Both the duration and the commission may only be raised after creation of the program: to lower them, the program must first be terminated and a new one created.

arguments.name: duration_months
arguments.comment: Indicates the duration of the affiliate program; if not set, there is no expiration date.

throws.name: BOT_INVALID
throws.comment: This is not a valid bot.

throws.name: STARREF_AWAITING_END
throws.comment: The previous referral program was terminated less than 24 hours ago: further changes can be made after the date specified in userFull.starref_program.end_date.

throws.name: STARREF_PERMILLE_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified commission_permille is invalid: the minimum and maximum values for this parameter are contained in the starref_min_commission_permille and starref_max_commission_permille client configuration parameters.

throws.name: STARREF_PERMILLE_TOO_LOW
throws.comment: The specified commission_permille is too low: the minimum and maximum values for this parameter are contained in the starref_min_commission_permille and starref_max_commission_permille client configuration parameters.

e.name: payments.botCancelStarsSubscription
e.comment: Cancel a bot subscription

arguments.comment:
If not set, disables autorenewal of the subscriptions, and prevents the user from reactivating the subscription once the current period expires: a subscription cancelled by the bot will have the {@link RawStarsSubscription}.bot_canceled flag set.
The bot can can partially undo this operation by setting this flag: this will allow the user to reactivate the subscription.

arguments.comment: The ID of the user whose subscription should be (un)cancelled

arguments.name: charge_id
arguments.comment: The provider_charge_id from the {@link RawMessageActionPaymentSentMe} service message sent to the bot for the first subscription payment.

e.name: stories.sendStory
e.comment: Uploads a Telegram Story. May also be used in a business connection, not by wrapping the query in {@link RawInvokeWithBusinessConnectionRequest}, but rather by specifying the ID of a controlled business user in peer.

arguments.name: pinned
arguments.comment: Whether to add the story to the profile automatically upon expiration. If not set, the story will only be added to the archive, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: noforwards
arguments.comment: If set, disables forwards, screenshots, and downloads.

arguments.name: fwd_modified
arguments.comment: Set this flag when reposting stories with fwd_from_id+fwd_from_id, if the media was modified before reposting.

arguments.name: peer
arguments.comment: The peer to send the story as.

arguments.name: media_areas
arguments.comment: Media areas associated to the story, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: entities
arguments.comment: Message entities for styled text, if allowed by the stories_entities client configuration parameter Â».

arguments.name: privacy_rules
arguments.comment: Privacy rules for the story, indicating who can or can't view the story.

arguments.name: random_id
arguments.comment: Unique client message ID required to prevent message resending.

arguments.name: period
arguments.comment: Period after which the story is moved to archive (and to the profile if pinned is set), in seconds; must be one of 6 * 3600, 12 * 3600, 86400, or 2 * 86400 for Telegram Premium users, and 86400 otherwise.

arguments.name: fwd_from_id
arguments.comment: If set, indicates that this story is a repost of story with ID fwd_from_story posted by the peer in fwd_from_id.

arguments.name: fwd_from_story
arguments.comment: If set, indicates that this story is a repost of story with ID fwd_from_story posted by the peer in fwd_from_id.

arguments.name: albums
arguments.comment: If set, adds the story to the specified albums.

throws.name: BOOSTS_REQUIRED
throws.comment: The specified channel must first be boosted by its users in order to perform this action.

throws.name: BOT_ACCESS_FORBIDDEN
throws.comment: The specified method can be used over a business connection for some operations, but the specified query attempted an operation that is not allowed over a business connection.

throws.name: CHANNEL_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided channel is invalid.

throws.name: CHAT_ADMIN_REQUIRED
throws.comment: You must be an admin in this chat to do this.

throws.name: IMAGE_PROCESS_FAILED
throws.comment: Failure while processing image.

throws.name: MEDIA_EMPTY
throws.comment: The provided media object is invalid.

throws.name: MEDIA_FILE_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified media file is invalid.

throws.name: MEDIA_TYPE_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified media type cannot be used in stories.

throws.name: MEDIA_VIDEO_STORY_MISSING
throws.comment: A non-story video cannot be repubblished as a story (emitted when trying to resend a non-story video as a story using inputDocument).

throws.name: PEER_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided peer id is invalid.

throws.name: PREMIUM_ACCOUNT_REQUIRED
throws.comment: A premium account is required to execute this action.

throws.name: STORIES_TOO_MUCH
throws.comment: You have hit the maximum active stories limit as specified by the story_expiring_limit_* client configuration parameters: you should buy a Premium subscription, delete an active story, or wait for the oldest story to expire.

throws.name: STORY_PERIOD_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified story period is invalid for this account.

throws.name: VENUE_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The specified venue ID is invalid.

e.comment: Edit an uploaded story May also be used in a business connection, not by wrapping the query in {@link RawInvokeWithBusinessConnectionRequest}, but rather by specifying the ID of a controlled business user in peer: in this context, the method can only be used to edit stories posted by the same business bot on behalf of the user with {@link stories.RawSendStoryRequest}.

arguments.comment: If specified, replaces the story media.

arguments.name: caption

arguments.name: entities
arguments.comment: Message entities for styled text in the caption, if allowed by the stories_entities client configuration parameter Â».

arguments.name: privacy_rules
arguments.comment: If specified, alters the privacy settings Â» of the story, changing who can or can't view the story.

throws.name: PEER_ID_INVALID
throws.comment: The provided peer id is invalid.

throws.name: STORY_NOT_MODIFIED
throws.comment: The new story information you passed is equal to the previous story information, thus it wasn't modified.

e.name: channels.reorderPinnedForumTopics
e.comment: Reorder pinned forum topics

arguments.name: force
arguments.comment:
If not set, the order of only the topics present both server-side and in order will be changed (i.e. mentioning topics not pinned server-side in order will not pin them, and not mentioning topics pinned server-side will not unpin them).
If set, the entire server-side pinned topic list will be replaced with order (i.e. mentioning topics not pinned server-side in order will pin them, and not mentioning topics pinned server-side will unpin them)

e.name: mtcute.customMethod
e.comment: temporary solution to allow users to call arbitrary methods not present in the schema, without having to override client's schema readers/writers map. will become redundant after esm tl rewrite

u.Error: An object containing a query error.
u.InputFileLocation: Defines the location of a file for download.
u.InputUser: Defines a user for subsequent interaction.
u.InputContact: Object defines a contact from the user's phone book.
u.InputFile: Defines a file uploaded by the client.
u.InputMedia: Defines media content of a message.
u.InputChatPhoto: Defines a new group profile photo.
u.InputPhoto: Defines a photo for further interaction.
u.Peer: Identifier of a private chat, basic group, group or channel (see here Â» for more info).
u.UserProfilePhoto: Object contains info on the user's profile photo.
u.ChatFull: Full info about a channel, supergroup, gigagroup or basic group.
u.ChatParticipants: Object contains info on group members.
u.ChatPhoto: Object defines a group profile photo.
u.MessageAction: Object describing actions connected to a service message.
u.PhotoSize: Location of a certain size of a picture
u.auth.SentCode: Contains info on a confirmation code message sent via SMS, phone call or Telegram.
u.auth.Authorization: Object contains info on user authorization.
u.InputNotifyPeer: Object defines the set of users and/or groups that generate notifications.
u.PeerSettings: List of actions that are possible when interacting with this user, to be shown as suggested actions in the chat bar
u.Contact: A contact of the current user.
u.ImportedContact: Object contains info on a successfully imported contact.
u.contacts.Contacts: Info on the current user's contact list.
u.contacts.ImportedContacts: Object contains info on successfully imported contacts.
u.contacts.Blocked: Info on users from the current user's black list.
u.messages.Dialogs: Object contains a list of chats with messages and auxiliary data.
u.messages.Messages: Object contains information on list of messages with auxiliary data.
u.messages.Chats: Object contains list of chats with auxiliary data.
u.messages.ChatFull: Full info about a channel, supergroup, gigagroup or basic group.
u.messages.AffectedHistory: Object contains info on affected part of communication history with the user or in a chat.
u.Update: Object contains info on events occurred.
u.updates.State: Object contains info on state for further updates.
u.Updates: Object which is perceived by the client without a call on its part when an event occurs.
u.photos.Photos: Object contains list of photos with auxiliary data.
u.DcOption: Information for connection to data center.
u.Config: Object contains info on API configuring parameters.
u.NearestDc: Object contains info on nearest data center.
u.help.AppUpdate: Contains info on app update availability.
u.help.InviteText: Object contains info on the text of a message with an invitation.
u.EncryptedChat: Object contains info on an encrypted chat.
u.InputEncryptedChat: Object sets an encrypted chat ID.
u.InputEncryptedFile: Object sets encrypted file for attachment
u.messages.DhConfig: Contains Diffie-Hellman key generation protocol parameters.
u.messages.SentEncryptedMessage: Contains info on message sent to an encrypted chat.
u.InputDocument: Defines a document for subsequent interaction.
u.help.Support: Info about the support user, relevant to the current user.
u.NotifyPeer: Object defines the set of users and/or groups that generate notifications.
u.SendMessageAction: User actions. Use this to provide users with detailed info about their chat partner's actions: typing or sending attachments of all kinds.
u.contacts.Found: Object contains info on users found by name substring and auxiliary data.
u.InputPrivacyKey: Privacy keys together with privacy rules Â» indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyKey constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyKey. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.PrivacyKey: Privacy keys together with privacy rules Â» indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyKey constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyKey. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.InputPrivacyRule: Privacy rules indicate who can or can't do something and are specified by a PrivacyRule, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyRule. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.PrivacyRule: Privacy rules together with privacy keys indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyRule constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyRule. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.DocumentAttribute: Various possible attributes of a document (used to define if it's a sticker, a GIF, a video, a mask sticker, an image, an audio, and so on)
u.account.PasswordSettings: Private info associated to the password info (recovery email, telegram passport info & so on)
u.account.PasswordInputSettings: Constructor for setting up a new 2FA SRP password
u.auth.PasswordRecovery: Recovery info of a 2FA password, only for accounts with a recovery email configured.
u.BotCommand: Describes a bot command that can be used in a chat
u.BotInfo: Info about bots (available bot commands, etc)
u.ReplyMarkup: Reply markup for bot and inline keyboards
u.MessageEntity: Message entities, representing styled text in a message
u.MessageRange: Indicates a range of chat messages
u.updates.ChannelDifference: Contains the difference (new messages) between our local channel state and the remote state
u.ChannelMessagesFilter: Filter for fetching only certain types of channel messages
u.help.TermsOfService: Contains info about the latest telegram Terms Of Service.
u.InputBotInlineMessage: Represents a sent inline message from the perspective of a bot
u.messages.BotResults: Result of a query to an inline bot
u.ExportedMessageLink: HTTP link and embed info of channel message
u.auth.CodeType: Type of verification code that will be sent next if you call the resendCode method
u.auth.SentCodeType: Type of the verification code that was sent
u.InputBotInlineMessageID: Represents a sent inline message from the perspective of a bot
u.InlineBotSwitchPM: The bot requested the user to message them in private
u.TopPeerCategoryPeers: Top peers by top peer category
u.MaskCoords: Mask coordinates (if this is a mask sticker, attached to a photo)
u.InputStickeredMedia: Represents a media with attached stickers
u.PhoneCallDiscardReason: Why was the phone call discarded?
u.InputWebDocument: Specifies a document that will have to be downloaded from the URL by the telegram servers
u.upload.CdnFile: Represents the download status of a CDN file
u.CdnPublicKey: Public key to use only during handshakes to CDN DCs.
u.ChannelAdminLogEvent: An event in a channel admin log
u.ChannelAdminLogEventsFilter: Filter for fetching events in the channel admin log
u.InputSingleMedia: A single media in an album or grouped media sent with {@link messages.RawSendMultiMediaRequest}.
u.InputDialogPeer: Peer, or all peers in a certain folder
